description: Returns a list of DescribeEvaluations that match the search criteria in the request.

parameters.name: FilterVariable
parameters.description: Use one of the following variable to filter a list of Evaluation objects: CreatedAt - Sets the search criteria to the Evaluation creation date. Status - Sets the search criteria to the Evaluation status. Name - Sets the search criteria to the contents of Evaluation Name. IAMUser - Sets the search criteria to the user account that invoked an Evaluation. MLModelId - Sets the search criteria to the MLModel that was evaluated. DataSourceId - Sets the search criteria to the DataSource used in Evaluation. DataUri - Sets the search criteria to the data file(s) used in Evaluation. The URL can identify either a file or an Amazon Simple Storage Solution (Amazon S3) bucket or directory.

parameters.name: Prefix
parameters.description: A string that is found at the beginning of a variable, such as Name or Id. For example, an Evaluation could have the Name 2014-09-09-HolidayGiftMailer. To search for this Evaluation, select Name for the FilterVariable and any of the following strings for the Prefix: 2014-09 2014-09-09 2014-09-09-Holiday.

parameters.name: SortOrder
parameters.description: A two-value parameter that determines the sequence of the resulting list of Evaluation. asc - Arranges the list in ascending order (A-Z, 0-9). dsc - Arranges the list in descending order (Z-A, 9-0). Results are sorted by FilterVariable.

nested_items.name: Results
nested_items.description: A list of Evaluation that meet the search criteria.

nested_items.name: EvaluationId
nested_items.description: The ID that is assigned to the Evaluation at creation.

nested_items.name: MLModelId
nested_items.description: The ID of the MLModel that is the focus of the evaluation.

nested_items.name: EvaluationDataSourceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the DataSource that is used to evaluate the MLModel.

nested_items.name: InputDataLocationS3
nested_items.description: The location and name of the data in Amazon Simple Storage Server (Amazon S3) that is used in the evaluation.

nested_items.name: CreatedByIamUser
nested_items.description: The AWS user account that invoked the evaluation. The account type can be either an AWS root account or an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user account.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The time that the Evaluation was created. The time is expressed in epoch time.

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The time of the most recent edit to the Evaluation. The time is expressed in epoch time.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: A user-supplied name or description of the Evaluation.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the evaluation. This element can have one of the following values:
PENDING - Amazon Machine Learning (Amazon ML) submitted a request to evaluate an MLModel.
INPROGRESS - The evaluation is underway.
FAILED - The request to evaluate an MLModel did not run to completion. It is not usable.
COMPLETED - The evaluation process completed successfully.
DELETED - The Evaluation is marked as deleted. It is not usable.

nested_items.name: PerformanceMetrics
nested_items.description: Measurements of how well the MLModel performed, using observations referenced by the DataSource. One of the following metrics is returned, based on the type of the MLModel:
BinaryAUC: A binary MLModel uses the Area Under the Curve (AUC) technique to measure performance.
RegressionRMSE: A regression MLModel uses the Root Mean Square Error (RMSE) technique to measure performance. RMSE measures the difference between predicted and actual values for a single variable.
MulticlassAvgFScore: A multiclass MLModel uses the F1 score technique to measure performance.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: A description of the most recent details about evaluating the MLModel.

nested_items.name: ComputeTime
nested_items.description: Long integer type that is a 64-bit signed number.

nested_items.name: FinishedAt
nested_items.description: A timestamp represented in epoch time.

nested_items.name: StartedAt
nested_items.description: A timestamp represented in epoch time.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The ID of the next page in the paginated results that indicates at least one more page follows.
